item.title: Creating a good, secure Docker base image
item.author: hello@heiber.im (Moritz Heiber)
item.description: tl;dr: Build small, efficient images, use Alpine Linux as your foundation, build from there, add glibc if necessary, remove static/generated files and documentation, never run more than one process per container and use verified, trustworthy sources. The premise When I first started using Docker, everyone kept raving about how easy and intuitive it was to use, how incredibly well it handled itself and how much time everyone was saving because of it.
